item.name: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine
Dice Pool Party
item.comment: How they were NOT able to match the colors of the dice to the colors on the score sheet is beyond me. Dice is yellow, score sheet has orange. Pinks do not match either. Game is fun but this color mismatch is annoying.

item.name: Forest Shuffle
item.comment:
Since you can usually grab whatever you want from the clearing, the "what card to pay with" decision rarely feels tense. You often just pick up the same card you played a turn earlier, and your opponent usually doesn't care, they're doing the same thing.
The game also feels way too long for what it offers. Once you choose a direction (say, going for birds), you're basically doing the same thing for the next 30 minutes, planting trees and adding birds to them, with little variation.
I like the idea behind the game, building a forest ecosystem sounds great, and the first 10â€“15 minutes are indeed fun. But it quickly becomes repetitive and overstays its welcome.
On top of that, cards that let you draw with effects like "whenever you play a tree card" feel unbalanced. If someone gets those early, they gain a huge advantage since they no longer need to spend turns drawing.
Overall: a mediocre experience for me. Nice theme and artwork, but too long, too repetitive, and lacking real tension in the choices.

item.name: Infinity Gauntlet: A Love Letter Game
Star Wars: Jabba's Palace â€“ A Love Letter Game
Swish
item.comment: It was much more fun than I expected. Allowing swishes with 2 cards make the game too easy. Playing with "at least 3 swishes" makes it quite fun.

item.name: World Wonders
item.comment:
House Rule: Extended Wonder Preview
At all times, six World Wonder cards are kept face-up and visible.
Players may only purchase World Wonders from the top three cards, following the normal rules and costs.
When a World Wonder is purchased, immediately slide the remaining cards up and reveal a new card so that six Wonders are always visible.
Purpose: This rule reduces forced or unmeaningful actions and allows players to plan ahead more strategically, without changing competition or purchasing limits.
